attributes.action: NO to the building of the 175 million pound pedestrian Garden Bridge in London.
attributes.additional_details: London has 35,000 acres of public green spaces equivalent to 40% of London's surface area, making London one of the greenest cities in the world. Spending £60 million of tax payers money on another green space is ludicrous.
attributes.background: £60 million of public money has been pledged to build this completely superfluous bridge and in this age of budget cuts, this is a colossal waste of money for one of the greenest cities in the world. This pedestrian bridge will precede Waterloo Bridge and is in memory of Princess Diana.

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the Garden Bridge. You might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/119185
